name: CT Perfusion
description: CT perfusion is an imaging technique that assesses blood flow in the brain using computed tomography imaging. It is used to identify areas of ischemia and guide clinical management.

attributes.name: tmax volume
attributes.description: Volume of tissue with Tmax greater than 6 seconds in milliliters.

attributes.name: mismatch volume
attributes.description: Difference between penumbra and core volumes in milliliters.

attributes.name: mismatch ratio
attributes.description: Ratio of penumbra to core volume.

attributes.name: hypoperfusion index
attributes.description: Index representing the severity of perfusion deficit.

attributes.name: ischemic core volume
attributes.description: Volume of ischemic core in milliliters.

attributes.name: cerebral blood flow
attributes.description: Cerebral blood flow compared to the contralateral side in mL/100g/min.

attributes.name: cerebral blood volume
attributes.description: Cerebral blood volume used to define infarct core in mL/100g.

attributes.name: target mismatch profile
attributes.description: Indicates the status of target mismatch profile based on multiple perfusion measures.
